dbi.Database

interface Database;
Database interface that all DBD's must inherit from.

abstract void connect(char[] conn, char[] user, char[] passwd);
Connect to a database.

Params:
char[] conn Connection string.
char[] user Username. Defaults to null.
char[] passwd Password. Defaults to null.

Throws:
DBIException on error.

abstract void close();
Close the database connection.

Throws:
DBIException on error.

abstract void execute(char[] sql);
Execute a SQL statement that returns no results.

Params:
char[] sql SQL statement to execute.

Throws:
DBIException on error.

abstract Statement prepare(char[] sql);
Prepare a SQL statement for execution.

Params:
char[] sql SQL statement to execute.

Returns:
The prepared statements.

abstract Result query(char[] sql);
Query the database.

Params:
char[] sql SQL statement to execute.

Returns:
A Result object with the queried information.

abstract Row queryFetchOne(char[] sql);
Query the database and return only the first row.

Params:
char[] sql SQL statement to execute.

Returns:
A Row object with the queried information.

abstract Row[] queryFetchAll(char[] sql);
Query the database and return an array of all the rows.

Params:
char[] sql SQL statement to execute

Returns:
An array of Row objects with the queried information.

deprecated abstract int getErrorCode();
Get the error code.

Deprecated:
This functionality now exists in DBIException.

Todo:
This function needs some thought. Should we wrap common SQL errors into a "D DBI" error code so that ALL DBD's report the same information? That's the way I am currently leaning. Any input?

Returns:
The database specific error code.

See Also:
getErrorMessage

deprecated abstract char[] getErrorMessage();
Get the error message.

Deprecated:
This functionality now exists in DBIException.

Returns:
The database specific error code.

See Also:
getErrorCode
